TopicTitle: Must say i love the new exhaust animations

Articles.Content:
I cant get over launching this rocket, probably the best thing about 1.0 and so on is all the new animations.

![Bzp86km.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Bzp86km.jpg)
If you mean the launchpad smoke, I love it too!

Oh yeah, I love that stuff. At one point i just aborted my rocket launch and vtol'd my rocket around launch pad and vab to watch the effects. Also starting and landing on other planets feels very different now, there is just something less static about the rocket engines whirling up all the dust. 

There is also the little side-effect of making it very easy to judge your altitude above ground.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-05T09:10:43Z" title="05/05/2015 09:10  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 5, 2015</time> by Temeter**
It kills my framerate, but is totally worth it xD
Oh yeah I love this effect and also (I don't where else you can see that) the dust when you're landing on Mun ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It kills my framerate, but is totally worth it xD

They are pretty, but the framerate effect is regrettable. I've got into the habit of aiming my camera skywards during launches just to speed things up.
Really? I haven't experienced any noticeable change in framerate form the new smoke fx. I was pleasantly surprised when they didn't slideshow my game.

I also really like them, makes launches and powered landings look so much better (and I don't find they impact frame rate too much).

The only thing about them that I don't like is there are several instances of a solid unchanging shape (a sprite I guess) that float about. Because there are several of them and they are identical it looks rather odd.

I circled a few of them in this pic;

[![1DFzQ2wl.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/1DFzQ2wl.jpg?1)](http://imgur.com/1DFzQ2w)
Turn a SRB upside down and launch it. You get a big ball of smoke with a pillar of fire in the middle of it.

> 
> I also really like them, makes launches and powered landings look so much better (and I don't find they impact frame rate too much).
> The only thing about them that I don't like is there are several instances of a solid unchanging shape (a sprite I guess) that float about. Because there are several of them and they are identical it looks rather odd.
> 
> I circled a few of them in this pic;
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/1DFzQ2wl.jpg?1](http://i.imgur.com/1DFzQ2wl.jpg?1)

They look like ghosts... maybe the lost souls of Kerbals past, floating around the launchpad wishing new voyagers a safe trip? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) lol

I love the new effects, they should've been implemented a long time ago. It is a bit of a framerate killer, though, but only if you're on an older machine.

> 
> They look like ghosts... maybe the lost souls of Kerbals past, floating around the launchpad wishing new voyagers a safe trip? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) lol

Wow, that's dark... o.O
They're amazing. With this and the shake effects, rockets actually feel powerful now.

> 
> They look like ghosts... maybe the lost souls of Kerbals past, floating around the launchpad wishing new voyagers a safe trip? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) lol

Dr. McNinja style?
The effects are pretty sweet, although I have to say I actually like it best on the far side on airless bodies (on the Mun, Minmus, etc)... makes it feel like it's really there...

> 
> Dr. McNinja style?

Gotta love the Doc!

Love those launch effects as well. They give me hope for stock clouds.
I love pulling up from the runway and seeing my engines kick up dust from the ground. Maybe they did that before, but I find myself flying a lot more planes with the new aerodynamics!

Guys, guys you got it wrong. The engines don't make the launch pad effect. They just moved the KSP toilets under the pad. The smoke is just it flushing and other gasses....

If it was the engines, we would have seen the effects before! ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

I tried to launch a rocket without enough TWR to lift off, and I couldn't shut it off since it was an SRB, so I recovered it while the engine was still lit...

![bZ9Gofw.png](http://i.imgur.com/bZ9Gofw.png)

The smoke was still drifting around the launchpad....

Easily my favorite 1.0 addition. Why stop at engine exhaust though? Squad needs to make that dust occur on impacts as well. Plane crashes should be very fiery *and* dusty. So far we only have one of those.
I haven't had framerate problems with the smoke, but my spontaneous rocket disassembly at 10,000m when my boosters collided into my main tank sure did slow things down for a while...

When I first read about this feature, I was rather disappointed (Harvesters long overdue feature), thinking it was completely useless/unneeded. 

Now that I am playing with it in the game, it's one of my favorite things!

> 
> They look like ghosts... maybe the lost souls of Kerbals past, floating around the launchpad wishing new voyagers a safe trip? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) lol

The EVA report at the launch pad does say there's a green goo everywhere. Maybe that particular smoke is what happens when the goo vaporizes.

While the launch plume effect looks great! In the back of my mind I was thinking that they were fixing the weird angle the smoke from the rocket exhaust takes during gravity turns.

Sort of like this...

Please disregard the periods (blasted kerning)

Flame <<<<<<< [Rocket

..................... O

...............O

O

Shouldn't it be more like?... 

Flame............. O <<<<<<< [Rocket

...............O 

..........O

......O

...O

O

Smoke

It's really noticeable on the SLS engines. Sorry it's the OCD kicking in ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
